required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sugammadex Provide Better Surgical Condition Compared With Neostigmine in Laryngeal Microsurgery.
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Sugammadex With Neostigmine in Laryngeal Microsurgery.

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to make a comparison of surgical condition and recovery time between rocuronium 0.45 mg/kg and neostigmine group and rocuronium 0.9 mg/kg and sugammadex group.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to make a comparison of surgical condition and recovery time between moderate neuromuscular bloackade with reversal using neostigmine group and deep neuromuscular bloackade with reversal using sugammadex group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of surgery, the surgeon rated the laryngoscopy condition
primary_outcome.description: Definitions for evaluation of Laryngoscopycondition. : Easy = jaw relaxed, no resistance to blade insertion, fair = jaw not fully relaxed, slight resistance to blade insertion, difficult = poor jaw relaxation, active resistance of the patient to laryngoscopy. Variables Excellent Good Poor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the injection of neostigmine or sugammadex up to 30 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: We measured recovery time ffrom the injection of neostigmine or sugammadex to TOF ratio 0.9

arm_group.description: when anesthetic induction, inrocuronium 0.45 mg/kg will be administered for muscle relaxation. When the end of operation, a injection of neostigmine or sugammadex will be administered.

When anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.9 mg/kg will be injected to rocuronium 0.9 - sugammadex group for muscle relaxation. When the end of operation,, a injection of neostigmine or sugammadex be administered.

intervention.description: At anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.45 to rocuronium 0.45 - neostigmine group or rocuronium 0.9 mg/kg to rocuronium 0.9 - sugammadex group will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four (TOF) using nerve stimulator. After operation, neostigmine 50 mcg/kg or sugammadex 4 mg/kgl be injected.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologist Physical status classification 1 or 2 elective laryngeal microsurgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI >25 or < 20 kg/m2 Patients taking intercurrent medication Glutamic Oxalacetate Transaminase or Glutamic Pyruvate Transaminase > 40 IU/L, Cr > 1.4 mg/dl

group.title: Rocuronium 0.45 - Neostigmine
group.description: when anesthetic induction, inrocuronium 0.45 mg/kg will be administered for muscle relaxation. When the end of operation, a injection of neostigmine or sugammadex will be administered. Injection of neostigmine or sugammadex: At anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.45 to rocuronium 0.45 - neostigmine group or rocuronium 0.9 mg/kg to rocuronium 0.9 - sugammadex group will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four (TOF) using nerve stimulator. After operation, neostigmine 50 mcg/kg or sugammadex 4 mg/kgl be injected.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events that result in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant incapacity or substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal functions, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect. 0 means that there were no participants who suffered Adverse events.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
